domestic.translation[0].definitions[0].d: relating to or happening in one particular country and not involving any other countries
domestic.translation[0].definitions[0].e: Domestic flights (=flights that stay inside a particular country) go from Terminal 1.
domestic.translation[0].definitions[1].d: relating to family relationships and life at home
domestic.translation[0].definitions[1].e: Unfortunately his domestic life wasn’t very happy.
families that can afford domestic help (=help with cleaning, washing etc)
an organization that supports women facing domestic violence (=violence in a family, especially from a husband to his wife)
Nowadays there is more sharing of domestic chores.
domestic.translation[0].definitions[2].e: a new tax on domestic fuel
domestic appliances such as washing machines
domestic.translation[0].definitions[3].d: someone who is domestic enjoys spending time at home and is good at cooking, cleaning etc
domestic.translation[0].definitions[4].d: a domestic animal lives on a farm or in someone’s home
domestic.translation[0].note_box[0].head: – Meaning 1: relating to or happening in one particular country and not involving any other countries
domestic.translation[0].note_box[0].sect: The French domestic market is the largest consumer of champagne.
Japan’s domestic economy expanded greatly during this period.
The president’s foreign and domestic policies have been criticized.
Colombia rejected any interference in its domestic affairs.
Exports fell by 0.5 percent while domestic demand grew.
In the past the country’s industry was small enough to thrive on domestic consumption alone.
London’s airports handle one hundred thousand domestic flights a year.
domestic.translation[0].note_box[1].head: – Meaning 2: relating to family relationships and life at home
domestic.translation[0].note_box[1].sect: domestic life
She enjoyed domestic life and bringing up three children.
domestic tasks
How many hours do you spend on domestic tasks each week?
domestic chores
Many people find domestic chores very tedious.
domestic responsibilities
It can be hard to balance your work and your domestic responsibilities.
domestic problems
I didn’t want to listen to any more of his domestic problems.
a domestic dispute
Police are often called to domestic disputes.
domestic violence/abuse
The organization supports women who are victims of domestic violence.
domestic waste
More domestic waste needs to be recycled.
domestic help
People in well-paid jobs can afford  domestic help.
domestic service
She went into domestic service at the age of 15.
domestic.translation[1].definitions[0].d: a servant who works in a large house
domestic.translation[1].definitions[1].d: a fight between members of a family in their home
domestic.translation[1].definitions[1].e: It sounded like the neighbours were having a bit of a domestic.
domestic.translation[2].definitions[0].d: relating to the home or the family
domestic.translation[2].definitions[0].e: dramatic rises planned on domestic fuel bills
domestic.translation[2].definitions[1].d: relating to the country you live in, rather than abroad
domestic.translation[2].definitions[1].e: The government hoped to halt the overall decline in domestic investment by restructuring industrial production.
Only farmers with a federal license can sell peanuts on thedomestic market.
Foreign concern over human rights issues does not constitute interference indomestic affairs.
